page.title: 13Energy
page.content: At least 90% of all households use North Sea gas for heating.Double glazing and cavity wall and loft insulation are increasingly being used to cut down fuel bills.Experimental solar panels are still very rare (see slide from Naphill). The homes of the 1980s are full of electrical equipment to make housework, cooking,gardening and do-it-yourself renovations as easy and efficient as possible.Almost every home uses a washing machine (with 70% also a tumble dryer), a freezer, refrigerator and vacuum cleaner.Food processors,toasters,sandwich makers, coffee makers,electric knives and many other gadgets speed up food preparation.About 25% of homes in our survey use a microwave oven and a dish washer. Power tools are in constant use.
